poem:
### Terminal Velocity

At dawn, runway rush hour halts,  
jets grounded, corrugated dreams  
of skyward ascent clipped.  
Forty gateways dimmed, air traffic  
muffled like whispers in storm,  
each delay a pause in progress  
as clock faces spin in disbelief.  
Breaths held in anticipation,  
wings folded, waiting  
for the sky to clear its throat.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US will publish list of 40 airports where air traffic will be reduced US airline regulators are expected to publish a list of 40 airports serving “high-volume markets” where air traffic will be reduced on Friday, a move that could would force airlines to cancel thousands of flights and create a cascade of scheduling issues and delays at some of nation’s largest airports. The Federal Administration Agency has said flights are being reduced to maintain". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

The Federal Administration Agency has said flights are being reduced to maintain
